result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe W Kiesner

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Peter Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Scott Alan Wales appeared by video for Joe W Kiesner. 
Defendant Joe W Kiesner appeared by video. 
Attorney Wales requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:06 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant Joe W Kiesner appeared by video.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty appeared by video for Joe W Kiesner. 
Not called on the record. 
Atty Wales updates the court that his client will be moving into Waukesha County and would like to take advantage of the DPA in this matter. 
Court sets status date.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 1:36 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joe W Kiesner in court by zoom with attorney Scott Alan Wales by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Wales requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:12 AM Defendant Joe W Kiesner in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant Joe W Kiesner in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has retained Attorney Scott Wales who was unable to make today's Court date.  The Court will adjourn for a status of counsel date and defendant gives dates Attorney Wales is available.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Joe W Kiesner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states he is trying to retain atty. Binder and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn and toll the time limits for prelim hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:08 PM Defendant Joe W Kiesner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
